chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Ziesman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *If probation is revoked, 3 days of jail credit

miscConds.notes:
*Pay Costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*Comply with the conditions of Probation as stated in Count 1 of 22CM20

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W Ziesman

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Oren Jakobson

Count 1:  Sentence Withheld and Placed on Probation 
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In
Count 3:  Dismissed and Read In

Defendant John W Ziesman in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for John W Ziesman.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CF-88, 22CF-89 and 22CM-20.

9:16 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

This is on for a plea and sentencing hearing. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement, joint stipulation.
22CM-20: Defendant will plead to sole count. 
22CF-88: Defendant will plead to Count 1.
22CF-89: Defendant will plead to Count 2. 
All other counts would be dismissed and read in. 
Atty Jambois explains the conditions of probation.
Atty Jakobson explains further as to the guardianship. 

Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CM-20: Count 1: No Contest.
22CF-88: Count 1: No Contest.
22CF-89: Count 2: No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty of 22CM-20: Count 1; 22CF-88: Count 1 and 22CF-89: Count 2.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of convictions this date.
22CF-88: Count 2 and Count 3: Dismissed and read in.
22CF-89: Count 1 and Count 3: Dismissed and read in. 

Atty Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Jakobson makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CM-20:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 1 year.
7 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Complete AODA Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Comply with the terms of the guardianship that are in place.
Comply with counseling or other recommendations deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.


22CF-88:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 1 year.
3 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 22CM-20.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges. 


22CF-89:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld.
Probation for a period of 1 year.
3 days jail credit.
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 22CM-20.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.
filed by the State

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:01 PM Defendant John W Ziesman appeared by video from North Central Health Care.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared via video for John W Ziesman. 

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

4:04 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, copy of complaint, is marked for ADA Jambois.
City of Stevens Point Officer Koback is sworn in.  
Direct examination by ADA Jambois.
4:05 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
ADA Jambois would ask that the record reflects the identification.
BY THE COURT:
Record reflects that witness has identified the defendant.
4:07 p.m.  ADA Jambois references exhibit #P1.
ADA Jambois would move exhibit #P1 into evidence subject to cross examination.  No objection by Atty Jakobson.  Received by the Court.
Cross examination by Atty Jakobson.
ADA Jambois has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Jambois no additional witnesses.
Atty Jakobson has no witnesses.
ADA Jambois gives brief final argument.
Atty Jakobson has no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:35 PM Defendant John W Ziesman appeared by video from North Central Health Care Center.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for John W Ziesman. 
Cases heard today are 22CF88, 22CF89 and 22CM20.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint in all 3 cases.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held on the 22CF88 and 22CF89.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued on all 3 cases.
Not guilty pleas to be entered on 22CM20.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John W Ziesman not in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for John W Ziesman. 

All files heard: 22CF89, 22CF89, 22CM20,

Atty Jakobson states a nurse called and left a message indicting the defendant is in the hospital and asks to adjourn. 
Atty Pfeil does not object.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:07 PM Defendant John W Ziesman appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF88, 22CF89 and 22CM20.

Court questions ADA Cassidy what she is seeking for bond.
ADA Cassidy responds and would like a small cash bond on each of these cases and states her reasons on the record.
ADA Cassidy would request a $200 cash bond on each case.
Atty Soule would request a signature bond and states her reasons on the record.
Atty Soule states her client is unable to post more than $400 in cash at this time.
1:10 p.m.  Sister of the defendant makes statements on the record.
Court finds that some cash is appropriate.
Defendant is informed to appear in person for his upcoming initial appearances 

BY THE COURT:
Warrants are quashed in each case.
22CF88 - $150 cash bond 
22CF89 - $150 cash bond
22CM20 - $150 cash bond 
with conditions as stated below  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Comply with terms of all open bonds.
Initial Appearance set for May 16, 2022 at 2:30 p.m.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:29 PM Defendant John W Ziesman not in court, Attorney Oren Jakobson appeared in court for John W Ziesman. 
State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $300  cash alternative on each file. 22CF88, 22CM20, and 22CF89
Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

02:34 PM Defendant John W Ziesman not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Pfeil indicates Atty Jakobson was present and had to leave to another courthouse.  Requests to adjourn.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
